articles.headline: Hunter Biden Indicted on Gun Charges
articles.snippet: The Justice Department charged President Biden’s son after the collapse of an earlier plea deal and amid an impeachment investigation by House Republicans.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department charged President Biden’s son after the collapse of an earlier plea deal and amid an impeachment investigation by House Republicans.
articles.lead_paragraph: Hunter Biden, the president’s son, was charged on Thursday by federal prosecutors with lying about his drug use when he purchased a handgun in 2018 and with illegally possessing the weapon, setting up the potential for a trial coinciding with his father’s re-election campaign.
articles.byline: By Michael S. Schmidt and Glenn Thrush

articles.headline: McCarthy Pulls Back Pentagon Spending Bill, Inching Closer to a Shutdown
articles.snippet: The House speaker abandoned efforts to move forward on a normally bipartisan military spending bill as far-right Republicans balked at the funding level, after pleading with his party to avert a shutdown.
articles.abstract: The House speaker abandoned efforts to move forward on a normally bipartisan military spending bill as far-right Republicans balked at the funding level, after pleading with his party to avert a shutdown.
articles.lead_paragraph: An urgent push by Speaker Kevin McCarthy to avert a government shutdown collapsed on Thursday as he bowed to resistance from his most conservative members and abandoned an effort to bring up a Pentagon spending measure this week.

articles.headline: U.A.W. Strike Looms Over Detroit Auto Show
articles.snippet: The three established U.S. automakers could struggle to get new cars and trucks to dealerships and customers if the walkouts drag on.
articles.abstract: The three established U.S. automakers could struggle to get new cars and trucks to dealerships and customers if the walkouts drag on.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Detroit auto show kicked off this week with a burst of hoopla and glam, including a Darius Rucker concert sponsored by Ford Motor and an indoor test track built by Jeep that features a hill with a 40-degree slope.

articles.headline: ‘One of the Most Hated People in the World’: Sam Bankman-Fried’s 250 Pages of Justifications
articles.snippet: The FTX founder wrote hundreds of pages of reflections and self-justifications while under house arrest, shedding light on how he may defend himself at his criminal trial next month.
articles.abstract: The FTX founder wrote hundreds of pages of reflections and self-justifications while under house arrest, shedding light on how he may defend himself at his criminal trial next month.
articles.lead_paragraph: At the end of a 15,000-word Twitter thread he never posted, Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of the failed cryptocurrency exchange FTX, offered a blunt assessment of his predicament.

articles.headline: Ireland’s Latest Fiscal Headache: What to Do With 10 Billion Euros
articles.snippet: The government in Dublin has a big budget surplus, thanks to a boom in tax revenue from multinational companies. Build more housing? Or a subway? Sock it away? Whatever the case, someone will be unhappy.
articles.abstract: The government in Dublin has a big budget surplus, thanks to a boom in tax revenue from multinational companies. Build more housing? Or a subway? Sock it away? Whatever the case, someone will be unhappy.
articles.lead_paragraph: Fifteen years after a collapsed housing bubble forced Ireland to borrow tens of billions of dollars or risk going bust, the country is discovering that having too much money can also be a problem.

articles.headline: Billionaire Ray Dalio Pushes for Return to Hedge Fund in Succession Clash
articles.snippet: Mr. Dalio retired from Bridgewater last year. But his successors at the world’s biggest hedge fund are discovering it’s not easy to operate with the firm’s founder looming over them.
articles.abstract: Mr. Dalio retired from Bridgewater last year. But his successors at the world’s biggest hedge fund are discovering it’s not easy to operate with the firm’s founder looming over them.
articles.lead_paragraph: Less than a year after retiring, Ray Dalio, the founder of Bridgewater Associates, the world’s largest hedge fund, is threatening his former colleagues with the one thing they have worked hard to prevent: his return.

articles.headline: As Junta Tightens Grip, Niger Is Being Strangled by Sanctions
articles.snippet: Border closures and a freeze on financial transactions imposed after soldiers seized power are hurting millions, while Western nations remain divided over what to do.
articles.abstract: Border closures and a freeze on financial transactions imposed after soldiers seized power are hurting millions, while Western nations remain divided over what to do.
articles.lead_paragraph: Since a military coup in Niger this summer, work days for Ahmed Alhousseïni have been consumed with calls from increasingly worried clients and colleagues asking the same questions.

articles.headline: Muslim Students’ Robes Are Latest Fault Line for French Identity
articles.snippet: When the French education minister declared that the abayas favored by some Muslim women “can no longer be worn in schools,” he stoked a fierce debate over the country’s secular ideals.
articles.abstract: When the French education minister declared that the abayas favored by some Muslim women “can no longer be worn in schools,” he stoked a fierce debate over the country’s secular ideals.
articles.lead_paragraph: The mass French return to work, known as the “rentrée,” is often marked by renewed social conflict. This year has been no exception as the summer lull has given way to yet another battle over a recurrent national obsession: How Muslim women should dress.

articles.headline: Biden Defends Striking Autoworkers: They Deserve a ‘Fair Share’
articles.snippet: White House aides believe the battle between the car companies and their workers underscores many of the president’s policy positions.
articles.abstract: White House aides believe the battle between the car companies and their workers underscores many of the president’s policy positions.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden forcefully sided with the striking United Auto Workers on Friday, dispatching two of his top aides to Detroit and calling for the three biggest American car companies to share their profits with employees whose wages and benefits he said have been unfairly eroded for years.
